title.narrative: Accelerating climate action and ambition on energy efficiency

description.narrative: Energy efficiency improvements in end-use sectors account for around 40 %of the total emissions reductions needed to deliver the goals of the Paris agreement. In addition to its impacts on the environment and climate, energy efficiency offers multiple benefits that are at the core of a sustainable future. Recognizing this, a number of leading organizations including the International Energy Agency (IEA), Sustainable Energy for All (SEforAll) and the Energy Efficiency Global alliance along with UNEP and the SEforALL Energy Efficiency Accelerators proposed one of the transformational initiatives, the 3 Percent Club. The initiative was one of the outcomes adopted by the Secretary General’s office. It aims at advancing partnerships between organizations, Government, academia and private sector to work towards a sustained 3% annual improvement in energy efficiency. To achieve that goal, the partners will work on raising ambitions on energy efficiency within the NDCs, helping in preparing action plans and matching Governments with the right solution providers. As the convenor of the industrial energy accelerator and a partner of the initiative, UNIDO will work with partners on creating a coordination team that will help in: (a) Engaging new countries to make more ambitious commitments on energy efficiency, (b) supporting member countries in identifying priorities, raising their awareness of energy efficiency opportunities in various end-use sectors and developing action plans and (c) developing harmonized tools for identification of energy efficiency opportunities across various sectors, ensure coordination with various members and tracking progress of the initiative.
